oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate Monument in Bolivar

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monuments; Trees
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Bolivar (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Confederate Monument in Bolivar. The monument is a stone obelisk carved to resemble a draped flag and topped with an urn-shaped decoration.; Text at the top declares the monument to be "one of the first erected in the South." Commercial buildings can be seen in the background.
The monument at Bolivar was unveiled in 1869. The town was named for South American revolutionary leader Simn Bolvar.
